techmeme.title: Apple joins UALink, an industry group working on a next generation AI accelerator architecture standard meant to challenge Nvidia's dominance with NVLink (Zac Hall/9to5Mac)
The US says the FBI hacked ~4.2K devices in the US to delete PlugX, malware used by China-backed hackers since 2014, after obtaining warrants in August 2024 (Carly Page/TechCrunch)
OpenAI launches Tasks, rolling out in beta to ChatGPT Plus, Team, and Pro subscribers, to let users schedule reminders, with up to ten active at any given time (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
Parallels rolls out an "early technology preview" of Parallels Desktop, for Macs with Apple Silicon, that has "really slow" support for x86 OSes like Windows 11 (Andrew Cunningham/Ars Technica)
OpenAI has appointed BlackRock exec Adebayo Ogunlesi to its board; last year, BlackRock acquired Ogunlesi's company Global Infrastructure Partners for ~$12B (Rachel Metz/Bloomberg)
